key_title: Key to the genera of Polygonaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Polygonaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Polygonaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Perianth segments 3–5, subequal, not distinctly in 2 whorls
Perianth segments 6 (at least in female or bisexual flowers), in 2 distinct whorls
Outer perianth segments not strongly keeled or winged
Outer perianth segments strongly keeled or winged in fruit
Flowers all or mostly bisexual; stigmas capitate; perianth not or barely enlarging in fruit
Flowers unisexual; perianth distinctly enlarging in fruit
Leaves triangular, almost as wide as long; nut much exceeding perianth
Leaves not as above; nut enclosed by perianth

Ochrea transparent or brownish-translucent, initially tubular, but sometimes soon disintegrating, often ciliate at apex; flowers in spikes or spike-like panicles; staminal filaments filiform or tapered gradually from base
Ochrea whitish or silvery, soon becoming deeply lacerated, glabrous; flowers solitary or few together in axils of leaves or reduced bracts; staminal filaments widely dilated in lower half
Much-branched shrubs; branches spine-tipped or leaves deciduous, naked branches appearing somewhat spiny
Twining, scrambling, prostrate to semi-erect subshrubs, or slender shrubs; branches not spine-tipped
Outer 3 perianth segments unawned, smaller than inner which often enlarge in fruit; perennial
Outer 3 perianth segments of female flowers larger than inner, awn-tipped, becoming enlarged and hardened in fruit; annual
Flowers bisexual; inner perianth enlarging in fruit, often developing wings, teeth or tubercles
Flowers unisexual; inner perianth segments not significantly enlarging in fruit; plants usually less than c. 30 cm high
Plant climbing; leaves hastate; inner perianth segments inflated, papery and prominently net-veined in fruit
Plant not climbing; leaves not hastate; inner perianth segments not inflated and papery (but often toothed and/or with spongy tubercles) in fruit
